logo: The art of doing things right.

cover.title: Bring your project to a safe harbor.
cover.subtitle: The digital ocean is infinite.

intro: You need to be very clear about one thing.
A business without a strong digital identity is a ship adrift, in the night, with its lights off.
No one sees you, no one is looking for you, and worst of all...
Don't worry, don't let that bring you down.
ocean:
The internet opens up an infinite ocean
of opportunities.
But there are too many fish in the sea...
Which technology to choose? Which provider to hire?

cta.warning: Don't be seduced by sirens leading you onto the rocks.

intro: If you think having a nice website is enough...
moreBody.competition: On the internet, each of your products competes on a global level. You have no choice but to seek excellence in every step of the process.
quality: That's why things must be done right. With

callToAction.title: So I recommend scheduling a call.
callToAction.text: Here's the link, I'm making it easy for you...

uncertainty: I don't know what you're good at.
Maybe you're a great entrepreneur, a Michelin-starred chef, the best florist in your neighborhood, or the King of the Omelet.
supportAreas: What I do know is that you wouldn't be here if you didn't need support in:
expertise: Fortunately, we are experts in this field.
I recommend you schedule a call and tell us your case.
solution: Because we will offer you the solution you need. No more, no less. Tailored to you. We will take care of everything.
focus: And that way, you can focus again on what you are a master at.
That which makes you smile in the mornings. Your business. Your creations. Your omelets...

finalCall.title: Haven't scheduled yet?
finalCall.text: Come on, take the plunge. Click.

intro: If you've made it this far, we're practically friends already.
So I'm going to be honest with you.
I got into Telecommunications because I wanted to learn how to hack Canal+.
creation: To create something new, something that was truly mine.
And help people who had created something that was truly theirs.
That is where it's truly worth breaking your back.

cta.text: If you want me to help you create yours, or make it grow

text: I've always been good at fixing things.
Whenever a gadget broke, I would take it apart. Many times it ended up worse than before, but other times, I got it working and considered myself a genius.
We only did integrals and differential equations. A total bore.
Until in my second year, I learned JavaScript.
I wrote code in a document and magically it appeared on the web.
You could see it, it was there.
Finally, something I could show my mother.
I barely passed other subjects, but in programming, I only got top grades.

paragraphs: I went through several startups, as a developer, obviously, and ended up in a big consulting firm.
And then, I went back to fixing things, just like when I was a kid.
Where there was code that didn't work at all, where clients were unhappy, where deadlines were looming and the team wasn't ready. That's where they sent me.
I swear, it was like the Seventh Cavalry. The special forces that rescue hostages at the end of the movie.
And in the end, I burned out.
I was tired of juggling to save the day for IBEX executives. And them not even knowing who I was, and me not knowing who they were.
I was tired of fixing other people's messes. I wanted to create.
